session.title: Simulation for Professional Services Agreement
session.jurisdiction_note: Contract governed by California law, with specific provisions for termination, indemnification, and compliance with state and federal regulations.

timeline.title: Agreement Effective Date
timeline.description: Contract takes effect upon board approval and notification to proceed
timeline.detailed_description: The Agreement becomes effective only after approval by the COMMISSION's governing board and notification to proceed by the Contract Manager. Work must not commence before this date.
risks: Work performed prior to approval is not reimbursable
Delays in board approval may impact project timeline

timeline.title: Monthly Invoice Submission
timeline.description: Invoices due within 45 calendar days after work performance
timeline.detailed_description: CONSULTANT must submit itemized invoices no later than 45 calendar days after performing work. Invoices must include labor details, expenses, progress reports, and cumulative charges.

timeline.title: Progress Payment Due
timeline.description: Payments made monthly in arrears upon approval of services
timeline.detailed_description: COMMISSION makes progress payments no less than monthly in arrears based on satisfactory services and actual allowable costs. Payment requires approval of work and valid invoices.
risks: Payment delays if deliverables are not met

timeline.title: Compliance and Audit Review
timeline.description: Monthly compliance checks and potential audit within 5 years post-payment
timeline.detailed_description: Regular monitoring of contract adherence, with records retained for 5 years from final payment. COMMISSION and auditors may inspect work and records at reasonable times.
risks: Audit disputes may lead to financial adjustments

timeline.title: Agreement End Date
timeline.description: Contract ends on specified date unless terminated or extended
timeline.detailed_description: The Agreement terminates on the end date unless earlier termination occurs or an extension is granted via contract amendment.
risks: Failure to complete work may lead to default

exit_comparisons.label: Termination for Convenience by COMMISSION
exit_comparisons.penalty_text: Allowable costs incurred plus termination costs
exit_comparisons.benefits_lost: Payment for work done, no further claims

exit_comparisons.label: Termination for Default by COMMISSION
exit_comparisons.penalty_text: Reprocurement costs and all reasonable expenses
exit_comparisons.benefits_lost: All unpaid amounts forfeited, liability for COMMISSION costs

exit_comparisons.label: Termination by CONSULTANT with 120-day notice
exit_comparisons.penalty_text: Reprocurement costs and all reasonable expenses
exit_comparisons.benefits_lost: Liability for COMMISSION costs, potential reputational damage

narratives.title: Ideal Contract Performance
narratives.subtitle: All terms met without issues
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT submits invoices on time, provides all required deliverables, and maintains compliance with all laws and insurance requirements. COMMISSION approves work promptly and makes payments as scheduled. The contract concludes successfully on the end date.
financial_impact: Total cost: As per agreed fee schedule

narratives.title: Default Termination Scenario
narratives.subtitle: CONSULTANT fails to cure breach within 10 days
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT breaches a contract term (e.g., fails to maintain insurance) and does not cure it within 10 days after written notice. COMMISSION terminates for default, leading to reprocurement costs and other expenses charged to CONSULTANT.
key_points: CONSULTANT liable for all reasonable expenses

narratives.title: Late Invoice Submission Impact
narratives.subtitle: Delays in billing lead to payment holds
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT submits invoices after the 45-day deadline, causing payment delays. COMMISSION may withhold payment until compliant invoices are received, impacting CONSULTANT's cash flow and potentially triggering compliance reviews.
financial_impact: Possible interest costs if financing gaps
No direct penalties, but indirect financial strain

long_term.label: Year 1
long_term.description: Base contract value with no penalties, assuming timely performance and payments

long_term.label: Year 2
long_term.description: Cumulative costs if contract extends or penalties accumulate from delays

long_term.label: Year 3
long_term.description: Maximum exposure with full term completion and potential audit adjustments

long_term.label: Year 5
long_term.description: Long-term including post-agreement insurance costs and audit reserves

risk_alerts.message: Insurance Compliance Risk: Failure to maintain required insurance coverage (e.g., General Liability, Workers' Compensation) allows COMMISSION to terminate immediately. Ensure all policies are active and certificates provided on time.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Regularly review insurance policies, set reminders for renewals, and submit certificates promptly to COMMISSION.

risk_alerts.message: Invoice Submission Deadline: Invoices must be submitted within 45 days of work performance. Late submissions can delay payments and trigger compliance issues.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Implement a billing schedule aligned with work completion dates to avoid missing deadlines.

risk_alerts.message: Default Termination Clause: COMMISSION can terminate for default with only 10 days to cure breaches. This includes failures in performance, insurance, or compliance with laws.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Monitor all contract terms closely, respond immediately to any notices of breach, and document cure actions.

risk_alerts.message: Indemnification Liability: CONSULTANT must indemnify COMMISSION for all claims, damages, and taxes related to negligence or misconduct. This could lead to significant financial exposure beyond contract value.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Maintain adequate professional liability insurance and conduct regular risk assessments to mitigate potential claims.

risk_alerts.message: Audit and Record Retention: Records must be kept for 5 years post-payment. Failure to provide access for audit can result in disputes and financial penalties.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Establish a secure record-keeping system and prepare for potential audits by retaining all relevant documents.
